page.title: 11Farming
page.content: The area in the survey is a rural district.Although farming is an important occupation in the area it does not involve that many people.The area can be divided north and south.The north has been planted this year with wheat and rapeseed.There are some fields of r0ugh grazing for beef and milk production.However it is the southern area where this is most important,since this the land that is low lying and closest to the river.There are perhaps 20 to 30 acres for barley ,but most is for the use of cattle and for silige.There are a few small fields, perhaps 20 acres,that are planted for strawberries.There is also a mushroom farm.One of the farms has a pedigree Jersey herd which is well regarded.The land is not of the highest quality and does not have any areas under glass.
